case_vignette: A 52-year-old man comes to the physician for a routine medical check-up. The patient feels well. He has hypertension, type 2 diabetes mellitus, and recurrent panic attacks. He had a myocardial infarction 3 years ago. He underwent a left inguinal hernia repair at the age of 25 years. A colonoscopy 2 years ago was normal. He works as a nurse at a local hospital. He is married and has two children. His father died of prostate cancer at the age of 70 years. He had smoked one pack of cigarettes daily for 25 years but quit following his myocardial infarction. He drinks one to two beers on the weekends. He has never used illicit drugs. Current medications include aspirin, atorvastatin, lisinopril, metoprolol, fluoxetine, metformin, and a multivitamin. He appears well-nourished. Temperature is 36.8°C (98.2°F), pulse is 70/min, and blood pressure is 125/75 mm Hg. Lungs are clear to auscultation. Cardiac examination shows a high-frequency, mid-to-late systolic murmur that is best heard at the apex. The abdomen is soft and nontender. The remainder of the physical examination shows no abnormalities.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Cardiovascular System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I feel well today, no symptoms.
Understood. Have you ever been diagnosed with any heart condition?
Yes, I had a myocardial infarction 3 years ago.
Got it. Are you currently taking any medications for your heart condition?
Yes, I am taking aspirin, atorvastatin, lisinopril, and metoprolol.
Do you have a family history of heart disease?
No, my father died of prostate cancer.
I see. Have you experienced any shortness of breath, chest pain, or palpitations recently?
No, I haven't experienced any of those symptoms.
I see. Is there a history of diabetes or high blood pressure in your family?
I have hypertension and type 2 diabetes mellitus myself, but the case vignette does not mention a family history of those conditions.
Thank you for that clarification. Have you experienced any dizziness or lightheadedness recently?
No, I have not experienced dizziness or lightheadedness.
**Final Diagnosis:** Post-myocardial infarction management with hypertension and type 2 diabetes mellitus
